column4: on what device would you normally expect the DVD drive to show up?
/dev/dvd doesn’t appear to have anything sensible at it
/dev/dvd
/dev/cdrom
same again, not at cdrw or dvdrw either
dmesg | egrep -i '(cd|sr|dvd)'
oh interesting, it seems to be detecting it as a CD drive only
it will often list a Blu-Ray or DVD drive as a CD in there, nothing to worry about.  look for the device.  probably sr0 or scd0 or hd* or sd*
/dev/sr0 is there, but ddrescue still reports “ddrescue: cannot open input file: No medium found”
no medium found is just a confusing way of saying "there's no disk in the drive"
right, which there is
eject it, make sure it's not upside down, make sure it's not badly scratched, wipe the surface, try again
what do you mean by ddrescuing a CD ?
it’s a DVD
DVD then
it’s dd, only better (it can deal with zero cells and other invalid crap that’s dumped onto the disk, or with scratches for example)
in the mean time, VLC thinks /dev/sr0 is the correct device, but fails to read from it too… Neither even seem to spin up the disk
the likelihood that the DVD drive is faulty is quite high
modern cheapo DVD drives tend to drop like flies
I’m thinking that too – weird that it read the CD to install ubuntu, but I guess there’s a different laser for reading DVDs or something
might want to try with another DVD first, and check the data cable is snug, and confirm you can eject with software ("eject /dev/sr0") as well
oh, good plans
eject on the device works fine, will check the data cable later, but I think it’s probably a dead drive
